hook.purpose: Stop the scroll BEFORE 'See more' cutoff, create curiosity
hook.research_note: First 150 chars determine if user expands post or scrolls. This is make-or-break.

guidelines.must_create_tension: CRITICAL - question, stat, problem, or emotion
guidelines.avoid_generic: NEVER use 'Here's what I learned' as hook
guidelines.test_rule: If boring without seeing more, rewrite

body.research_backed: LinkedIn data shows 1,200-1,600 chars drives 2x engagement vs shorter posts

formatting.research_note: Mobile users scan, don't read. Short lines and breaks are critical.

types.soft: engagement (questions, saves, comments) - Comments weighted 2x by algorithm
types.value: lead capture (free resources, DM triggers) - For newsletter/list building
types.direct: booking (call links, consultation offers) - For immediate conversions

best_practices.action_verb_required: USE: Ask, Share, Reply, Comment, Save NOT: Let me know
best_practices.specificity: Be specific - not 'What do you think?' but 'What's YOUR biggest challenge with X?'
best_practices.research_note: Comments drive algorithm more than likes. Questions get 5-7x more comments.

hashtags.research_backed: Posts with relevant hashtags get 30% more engagement
hashtags.avoid: Avoid hashtag stuffing - kills post readability

optimal_times.research_note: First 60-90 minutes (golden hour) determines 70% of post's reach

golden_hour_critical.first_90_minutes: Engagement velocity is PRIMARY ranking factor
golden_hour_critical.action: MUST engage with comments within 60 min of posting
golden_hour_critical.impact: Early engagement signals quality to algorithm, expands reach 3-5x

posting_frequency.note: Quality > Quantity. One great post beats 5 mediocre ones.
